name: ECB Guild Archive & ECB Guild Filter Update Log & Discussion
author: DoesntPlayAnymore

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
SpoilerECB Guild Filter V2.1: There are certainly mistakes and I only added the top build in every thread except for Elven Guardian. For the purposes of creating a Guild Archive, however, I have all the data I need to get started. Therefore, I would like to request that the continued validation, maintenance & updating of the ECB Guild Filter be the responsibility of someone else. With his unique skillset, detective mind and dedication, I believe Orion2019 to be an obvious and excellent candidate for the task. Furthermore, Valerfor suggested we scrounge the "Unfinalized Builds" and attempt legalizing them. I believe this warrants further discussion. ECB Guild Archive: With the above model, work on the ECB Guild Filter and Archives can happen independently. Whenever the Filter is updated, you just pop the new one into the Archive folder and run BuildIndexer.exe and everything should get synchronized. It also means that if I ever leave the project keeping everything updated will be trivial for my successors. I will keep this thread updated with any news. Update:
Update Aug 18
Beta version of the Archive is now available here: https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... archive-v2

Project description:

The new Epic Character Builders (ECB) Guild Archive Search Engine, powered by The ECB Guild Filter.
The Epic Character Builders Guild has been running since 2002 and has had over 2000 contributors. This search engine is designed to assist Neverwinter Nights 1 players to help players find character builds that suit their play style.
This is a beta version uploaded to gather feedback from the community. It encompasses all finalized builds from 2010 and onwards. At the moment, it's a glorified search engine - no builds are archived yet. It is still possible to use it as a superior search engine when looking for builds. Local archive will be implemented in the near future.

Usage:
  1. Download and unpack "ecb archive v2.0b.zip"
  2. Open ecba.html
  3. Search filters are expandable. Enter criteria and click 'filter'.
  4. Builds will show up on the right. Builds are external links to their ECB Guild forum posts.
Feedback is very appreciated. Whatever you can think of - layout, appearance, wanted features, bugs - please let me know.
Full credit goes out to HipMaestro and Stagmeister for creating the Guild Filter. Orion2019, Valerfor, Mick Dagger and many others for help with collecting newer builds. Special thanks to Orion2019 for help with this description and general feedback.
Enjoy!

Enjoy!
Spoiler
SpoilerUpdate Aug 4: Like this Now like this ---- Neat!
SpoilerUpdate Aug 5: Implemented hiding of filter categories. Hides all on start-up - this can be changed. Check out these screenshots: Can of course combine different filters: Overall I'm fairly satisfied with the progress. There's still a bunch to do, though. I want to implement the remaining filters, and the entire thing could really be prettier.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
It looks really good! I think the output is lovely. 

Just minor suggestions on the display 

- "Classes:" is probably better displayed as "Class level ranges:"

I liked it when you displayed Min Combat Vitals but I see you've changed it ?

Likewise with Min final abilities and Min final saves

Also I think there was a column for primary attack (melee, ranged, spellcaster or hybrid) which I think is valuable from a search perspective? 

Also the primary attack ability (ie Str/Dex/Wis/Cha/Int) is valuable to include in the search function if possible. Like its nice to know what Dex based builds are out there, and how good they look :)

Some of the skills and feats in the dataset are nice to include too in the search function (but not all of them). Some of the ones I think are valuable include:

Devastating Critical, Deathless Mastery, Divine Might, Divine Shield, Dragon Shape, Epic Dodge, Epic Damage Reduction, Epic Mage Armor, Epic Warding, Epic Traps, Hide in Plain Sight, Lasting Inspiration, Multiple Weapon Foci, Smiting focus, Taunting focus, Terrifying rage, UMD, Zen Archery
Anyway in the end this is your work but I am somewhat anxious to drop some suggestions before your vacation has ended as we will lose access to your skills! maybe the others will have suggestions too or disagree/agree with what I have written and I welcome any other commentary RE the search function!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This is looking bloody awesome.

The local link idea is brilliant. Would this enable the NWN community to prevent the builds being lost to a forum shutdown?

One I think low effort idea I just thought of was a very basic analytics type feature
If one runs a search, perhaps the result can be divided by the total number of builds to know how frequent the class combo / the features searched for have been used in past.

For example I see a few couple of a few Ranger 35/Fighter 4/Shadowdancer 1 builds written in 2009. I'm curious if this is a common class combo or not.

I search for such builds in your engine. The dataset brings up 10 results. Then simply divide by the total number of builds (maybe 1000 or something like that) and we get a percentage of builds result (like 1.0%).

Then I want to know frequent such builds are with devastating critical. I simply check the devastating critical box, the dataset brings up for example 3 results, this is divided by the total number of builds and I get a percentage of 0.3%. 

Anyway just food for thought. I don't know how interested you are in that idea but again just wanted to catch you before your vacation is over. I think it would be nice :)

Kalistez : 
One thing to be aware of is that many of the early builds were made prior to patch 1.69, and are therefore no longer legal.
Kalistez brings up a good point. There is a checkbox in the data entry in the filter database which will comment whether a build is legal in 1.69. Is it hard to add this to the search engine?

Addit: Another idea I had was searching by author, or publication year? I think that should be in the dataset

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote: What a wizard!
Whatever you can think of concerning the data... It's probably doable. Everything in the Guild Filter is stored as a Javascript object (made in Python), so it's super simple to access it.
Spoiler

Code: Select all

function filterPrimaryAbility(builds) {
  let primaryAbility = document.getElementById("primaryAbilitySelect")
    .selectedOptions[0].value;

  if (primaryAbility === "any") return builds;

  return builds.filter(b => b.abilities["Primary Attack"] === primaryAbility);
}
It's just a matter of priority, time/effort things like that...

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content: Beta version of the archive is available - check the OP.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
It has been two weeks since the beta was linked in the OP.
I have done some testing and have some feedback:
Overall this is indeed a promising tool. When the old archive is added, it will be overwhelming.
The layout is simple and clinical. I like that. Of course there could be fancy backgrounds and flashy gimmicks, but rather not.
As for the filter itself: In most cases it works as intended.

When I installed the tool, the first thing i did was to create a shortcut to my desktop. That did not work, I only got a distorted picture of the page. It worked fine when I opened it from its folder and it also works fine from a bookmark. I use Mozilla firefox and have Win10.

Regarding the filters
The class levels: The three boxes with min/max level 0-40 are good. The drop down menus should be in alphabetical order, perhaps with base classes listed first.
Races looks good.
Minimum combat vitals: It just looks confusing. I don't understand what goes where.
Minimum final abilities looks good. Primary ability is a fine extra and it also seems to work.
Minimum final saves looks good.
Meta: Type looks good. Xp penalty is just wrong: 309 builds with 40% penalty, 306 with 20%, 251 with 0% and 310 with any! Author is case sensitive, and that is probably best. Primary attack looks good except for hybrid builds. They seem too loosely defined. There are builds without caster levels and builds with only one level. (I also missed my own Spellsword of Bahamut there)
Characterization has a very long and seemingly incomplete list of different skills and feats. I was not able to look for a build with sneak attack and knockdown. It may be wise to have a closer look at this and what we want it to do. I struggled with understanding many of the abbreviations, so I recommend that you use the full words. The "1.69 legit" does not work, nothing shows up.

There is still some work to be done, but this program is a gem and has much to offer the NWN community.

posts.author: MentalDekay
posts.content:
To use the "v1.69 legit" search, build_index.js needs to be edited for each legit build (or build using that "characterization").

Old:

Code: Select all

'characterization': {'v1.69 legit': 'Y'}
New:

Code: Select all

'characterization': {'v1.69 legit': 'X'}
This worked on my local files. Notepad++ made it easy to do on all 290ish 1.69legit builds with a proper 'Replace All'.

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
@Mick Dagger 
Thanks for the feedback - everything is noted. This is the first weekend I've had since posting the Beta with actual time to do creative stuff, so I'll see how much I can get implemented in the next few days.

The drop down menus should be in alphabetical order, perhaps with base classes listed first.
Yeah, I agree. This is due to me loading stuff directly from the ECB filter and storing it in an unordered data structure (hash table) - it's easily fixed but takes some time to do it manually and I wanted to release the beta before school/work happened.

Minimum combat vitals: It just looks confusing. I don't understand what goes where.
If anybody could help me with making this more clear that would be great. Here's what the stuff means:
  • Ranged AB - Minimum naked ranged AB in finished build. (lvl 40, 30, 20, free)
  • HP - Minimum Hit Points in finished build.
  • Naked AC - Minimum naked AC in finished build
  • Melee AB - Minimum AB in finished build.
  • APR - Minimum attacks per round in finished build.
I was not able to look for a build with sneak attack and knockdown.
Sneak attack is not a feature in the ECB Filter excel file - it of course can be extrapolated (Rogue levels, BG levels), but I think that's further down the line. Knockdown I will have to look into.
 Xp penalty is just wrong: 309 builds with 40% penalty, 306 with 20%, 251 with 0% and 310 with any! 
It's 40% or lower since I thought that would be most common use case. What has happened to that one build (309 with x<=40%), I do not know. Again, if anybody is skilled at communication, and can help with concise descriptions I would greatly appreciate it.

E, figured out a solution: The answer is check boxes.
Primary attack looks good except for hybrid builds. They seem too loosely defined. There are builds without caster levels and builds with only one level
Absolutely agree with this - what should we do?
Characterization has a very long and seemingly incomplete list of different skills and feats. 
I agree, but that's what's available in the filter. I just loaded everything for convenience, but I think it should be either trimmed (easy) or expanded (time consuming, would have to expand the ECB Filter for that.)
I struggled with understanding many of the abbreviations, so I recommend that you use the full words. The "1.69 legit" does not work, nothing shows up.
Yeah, that's the ECB filter being loaded directly. I agree with you and will change it.


Also happy to see it works with Firefox (even with the shortcut issue.) It also works on Chrome. I tried it on IE and it was completely broken, which is confusing because I tried to make the thing to support multiple browsers. Luckily no one (of worth) uses IE hehehe. 

There's probably still a few builds missing - Spellsword of Bahamut is iconic, so funny that that one should be missing.

@MentalDekay 
That's a mental fart on my part, hah, thanks for catching it. Will fix it.

posts.author: MentalDekay
posts.content:
@(Homey)DontPlay(That)Anymore

FWIW on IE.. my work still uses ie11 as the "official" browser (glad we're a tech company). I tried it in there. It didn't want to read/acknowledge the JavaScript files without me adding <!doctype html> at the top of the file. I also surrounded the rest of the file with <html></html> for good measure. The next issue it had was with finding functions in search.js.

Take this all with a grain of salt because I'm pretty sure IT has 'customized' IE in some/many ways.

I have MS Edge on the same computer (so same network settings, ancient Java versions, etc). The html worked fine in it.

I usually use chrome (not the latest version, because IT). That's where I confirmed the v1.69 tag thing.

And lastly, I'm do hardware and program like a 3rd grader. So there's that. You've been warned. ;)

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:When the old archive is added, it will be overwhelming.
There is a simple barrier in the way of achieving this right now

Enough data (we are talking about 2000+ builds I recall) from the old archive is in the new filters format to make it workable including current active links except one important column - classes and class amounts


This is an example of the old archive data set which needs to be converted to allow DPA's search engine to search the old archive data as well
Spoilerdruid 22 / monk 8 / shadowdancer 10   fighter 6 / wizard 11 / arcane archer 23  monk 15 / dwarven defender 18 / weapon master 7  fighter 8 / paladin 6 / champion of Torm 26  barbarian 17 / fighter 16 / weapon master 7  druid 5 / shifter 17 / dwarven defender 18  fighter 10 / weapon master 7 / wizard 23  bard 16 / champion of Torm 14 / red dragon disciple 10
To this:
SpoilerArcane Archer     Assassin     Bard     Barbarian        Blackguard      .... etc...         28                                           5                                           7


Alternatively if one has exceptional programing skills, one can interpret the data in the original format and make it work into the search engine without having to convert it

Doing it by hand is not practical with 2000+ builds

Anyway this was a tricky problem I couldn't solve. Was hoping someone in the forum might have a solution. Otherwise I can put out an SOS on NWN Reddit :)


There is missing data for the archive data that was never entered such as  whether builds have multiple weapon foci, devastating critical, epic dodge or dragon shape, but I think most players will be happy they can find appropriate builds in question with the class combinations with access to the link to the build in question


Anyway if anyone can help post a reply

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content: @MentalDekay You don't sound mentally decayed at all. Do you Python? I made all the html in Python with the yattag library. If I were to github the project, would you like to/be able to collaborate?

posts.author: MentalDekay
posts.content:
I'm being totally honest when I say I'm not a good programmer. Unfortunately. In the past I've learned and forgotten how to deal with MANY* languages. But I can't create with any of them. The best I can do is take something close to what I need and change it slightly to make it work (imperfectly) for me. That and use a debugger. It's what I did with your HTML and JavaScript files. I cribbed the doctype thing from an online programming tutorial which said it's required in HTML4 (tho optional in 5). Then put it together that IE is so old it's probably not HTML5 compatible/compliant. .. Not to mention seeming to recall articles complaining about MS's ability to adhere to the standard.

The connections I couldn't make revolved around how to get IE/HTML to accept that the JavaScript functions were defined in the HTML header. My next thought is that it looks like a dependency issue, but I don't know if that's true.

All this said, I'd hazard to guess that Perl and regular expressions would do exactly what you need for old builds. But maybe not tho if the formatting is not consistent enough.

If I thought it'd be helpful, sure. I'd probably be ok at problem solving specific issues, but I really am best left to designing inverters, simulating circuits, and creating change requests because I forgot to include a resistor change in the latest build charts.

* C/C++, Fortran, Ada, PowerPC assembly, Matlab, Perl, Spice, MAST, Linux and DOS scripting, HTML, LaTeX, BASIC ... I swear I'm missing a half dozen others..

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
All this said, I'd hazard to guess that Perl and regular expressions would do exactly what you need for old builds. 
That's how I would do it (but with Python.) The problem is more dealing with 2000+ builds with only some of the metadata in the ECB filter, then we'd have to check what is available when searching - it'll get messy. In any case, I think it's pretty far down the line.
I really am best left to (...) creating change requests because I forgot to include a resistor change in the latest build charts.
Story of my life.
If I thought it'd be helpful, sure.
Would it? I've used git maybe 3 times in my life, but life is super busy and I would appreciate any helping hand.

I'll just end this by saying I'm not a very skilled programmer either. Mostly I'm just curious and stubborn, hah.

Damn it, why haven't I thought about using Excel formulas during my vacation?

Check the attached file and let me know if this is what we need to have. Same file, with two excel formats.

Through some Excel formulas I have created this file, which lists for all the old nwn ecb guild's builds:
  • Name
  • Race
  • How many levels are taken for each class (ecb guild archive's style).
If you want I can customize it furtherly; I have checked the correction of the level split formula and it seems ok, I would however appreciate any random checks on some builds just to be sure.

The only issues to fix for this file are:
  • remove the question mark right after the race name, if needed;
  • the formula used to extract the number of levels extracts two characters, so for levels lower than 10 the outcome is "number+space" (need to remove it to obtain a number). Moreover each number is displayed in text format instead of numeric --> EDIT: fixed, uploaded updated files
Let me know if there are corrections to be performed

EDIT: found two errors, one of them relates to two halfling builds listed in the same row (check sheet "errors" for additional details).
